content.detailedDescription: I was looking at sgv mt. and saw 2 light floating from n. ne.Dirtion
content.summary: July 4 2013

content.detailedDescription: It was roughly 10:05 pm i was taking my trash out and fireworks were going off in the neighborhood i looked up to see them and that is when i noticed a bright red circular ball in the sky, it was very low in the skyline, at 1st i thought it was a helicopter except there was no noise and it changed direction in a way that i knew it was no ordinary aircraft, it went right then left i took a picture of it on my camera phone, and then a 2nd one joined it, it looked roughly a mile apart from the 1st one and then they zipped away at an amazing speed heading nw, the whole event lasted roughly 2 minutes. i didn't have alot of time to react but i did manage to get 1 picture, this was so exciting this has been my 3rd sighting of a ufo since i was a kid. the red ball had long extensions appearing to be wings of some sort extending from both sides of it, this was flying very low as my picture has my neighbors house in the background and that is how i was able to see the extensions which i call wings but they were too big to be wings of a normal craft at that height. i then called my brother in law cause i was so excited, he only lives a mile away, cause i wanted him to go outside and see if he could see it but as i said it happened so fast by the time he went outside they were gone
content.summary: There was 1 bright red ball and then a 2nd 1 appeared roughly a mile away from the 1st one both were heading in the same direction changing course several times

content.detailedDescription:
While driving on a local highway at around 10:15pm, i saw a bright, fuzzy red light traveling at a low rate of speed over herculaneum, missouri. i noticed something odd about this light, so i pulled off at the herculaneum exit and stopped to observe. i tried to drive its approximate location, but the light went out.

i returned to the highway and observed the object reappear near pevely, mo moving southwest. i pulled off at the pevely exit and followed it as it moved over a quarry, but i could not pursue further. 

this object was *not* fireworks. it was a slow moving, low flying, bright object. it made no discernible noise. it was a still night and the object would have been traveling opposite of the normal wind direction, so it probably wasn't a balloon or chinese lantern. i did not observe running lights, however conditions were slightly hazy due to fireworks.

the next day, i talked with a mufon member who observed an object matching the exact description of this object moving south over arnold, missouri at roughly the same time-frame. it flew consistent with the speed and altitude of an ultralight aircraft.
content.summary: Red glowing object - pevely/herculaneum

content.detailedDescription: Sitting on deck after dinner and saw a steady orange light moving north.
content.summary: Steady light moving south to north

content.detailedDescription:
I was outside getting my dog inside when i saw a light and thought it was a helicopter over the 401.  the local police only have one helicopter, so after the third sighting i thought the objects were flares, but flares don't move in a horizontal direction. 

i witnessed about the 30 objects heading in north west direction as if they were following the highway. the seemed to follow the same path and have the same altitude. after several minutes i went to the front of my house to see the path these things were taking and asked my neighbours to come outside to make sure i wasn't seeing things. both my neighbours witnessed the same reddish orange objects flying in a straight line every 10-12 seconds. they saw about 6 in total. the objects appeared to be ascending in a slight incline as they headed towards the west - but this could be my angle of observation - before i lost sight of them. i could tell by looking though a hole in a tree across the street foliage these objects weren't too high but i couldn't tell the exact angle. i heard no sound from the objects only the background noise of the city. the speed moving across the sky was approximately the same as a civilian aircraft. when i was researching my experience on the internet some comments and website suggested chinese lanterns but these objects were moving too fast in what appeared to be a purposeful direction on what appeared to be a almost windless night. 

both of took some pictures but the objects appear to be mostly red and more dull on mobile. let me know if you want them. however, my personal email is down right now; should be up tomorrow.
content.summary: Reddish orange glowing balls

content.detailedDescription: 4th of july, pittsburgh pa  - downtown on "south shore" for fireworks.  after fireworks were complete we were leaving station square, a plaza of restaurants, shops and hotels on the waterfront and that's were the lights came into view.  the lights appeared in the east, fireworks had been set off in the west.  the lights were over the hills to the east/southeast.  i observed a "string" of yellow/orange/red lights with a cluster of lights at one end.  i pulled out my phone and told my family to look up.  they also saw the lights.  i stopped walking and took as many pictures with the camera in my phone as possible.  i would walk a few feet and stop to take a picture, the lights appeared to be moving also.  the string of lights appeared to descend behind the hills except a few as i walked and stopped.  i could not continually watch the lights while i walked.  the cluster disappeared and only a couple remained and seemed smaller than what i originally observed.  there were thousands of people going to the same parking lot as we were but no one seemed to be observing what was going on in the sky.  i kept telling my husband and kids to look up.  the last observation i made was of a triangle shape of three lights.  it was moving north in line behind a couple of the smaller circular lights.  i stood still while the triangle passed overhead.  the three  lights moved as if attached to a structure, slow moving, silent.  the lights moved at the same time, together.  i told my husband to look up again and i said " that looks like those lights are attached to some type of craft but i could not see any body of a craft, just dark between the lights.  no stars were visible, pittsburgh and surrounding areas had been under cloud cover for at least seven days.  no rain, no lightning at time of observation.   no planes or other conventional aircraft were observed at the same time as the lights. photos attached, enlarge to view lights.
content.summary: Multiple lights in string formation & also large triagnle of lights, 3 lights of triangle

content.detailedDescription: I had stepped out onto my patio at night, around 10 pm, and noticed a light in the sky. at first it looked like an airplane because it was blue with a red blinking light to the left side of the craft. however, it was moving very quickly straight upwards, a lot faster than any aircraft i had ever seen, so i watched it because it was quite unusual. then it stopped completely and suddenly. it then moved towards the left very quickly, then stopped.. i was then calling for my boyfriend to come and look at this since he is an aircraft inspector and what i was seeing was quite bizarre. he came out as soon as he could. when he got there, the craft had moved back into it's original position, but then the blue light changed to green but the red light was still blinking and then it slowly started to descend in the sky and disappeared behind the tree tops. some other people were lighting fireworks off in the neighborhood, but not in that area that the craft was in and i've never seen a firework or anything of that nature perform these maneuvers or blink in the way it was blinking because it looked just line any other airplane. but i've never seen an aircraft or helicopter move as quickly as this did and perform these impossible feats either. my boyfriend saw it for the last 10 seconds and when i told him what it had done he told me that it would be impossible for any aircraft to do that and i agreed.
content.summary: Sighting that appeared to be an airplane at first but moved too quickly and darted back and forth to be an airplane.

content.detailedDescription: My nephew and i were driving east on route 6 when i noticed out of the corner of my eye a long streak appearing in the sky and clouds, as if something flew right through them at a high rate of speed and heat. at one point, one of the smaller clouds appeared as if someone took an eraser and made a perfect mark in the middle of the cloud. in one picture you can see the mark in a cloud in which i just had described. there was no aircraft visible at this time. i've seen planes and helicopters fly through clouds before and never seen them leave a print like what i saw in the clouds on this particular day. note the 3rd picture, in the lower part of the picture you can observe the cloud at there is a partial area that is looks like someone erased a little section perfectly.
content.summary: Only witnessed a pattern in the clouds as if something cut through them at a high rate of speed along with heat.

content.detailedDescription: Went to let the dogs out this morning and there was a triangle shaped object with 3 red lights underneath it flying from south to north above the tree line. you could see that it was an equilateral object. it made a noise but not like a hum and not like a plane that would fly overhead on it's way to sea-tac airport. it was flying above the trees and my big dog and i watched it fly behind my neighbors trees going north. holding my thumb out at a 45 degree angle, the object was bigger than my thumb. it is currently 59 degrees out, clear, warm and it was light out. i did take pictures of the sky afterwards with my phone (i retrieved this after sighting) showing the weather condition right after the sighting. i have also reported this sighting to the national ufo reporting center on 07/02/13 at 5:10am
content.summary: Red-orange lights on equilateral triangle

content.detailedDescription: Was out in the backyard with my wife when she noticed a reddish orange object   to the southwest traveling at approximately the same rate of speed as a small aircraft, in between sporadic fireworks we did not detect any sound or noticed any flashing flight lights, object then appeared to hover for about 10 seconds then turned and began moving to the east and appeared to gain altitude and move at a very high rate of speed until it vanished behind my neighbors house  approx. 50 deg.S above horizon.
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Red orange orb in flight west to northeast, hovered, started flight upwards and east at high rate of speed

content.detailedDescription: This ufo was seen by several people at a 4th of july party, plus probably many others around whitefish, mt. it was suggested that it could have been a hot air balloon that was lit on fire for the 4th, but it seemed to go too fast for that and showed up three different times in the course of two hours. it looked like a flaming or glowing orange ball that rapidly flew across the sky, sometimes becoming very bright. the last time it flew straight over the top of us, and didn't appear to be very high. there was at least ten of us that saw it at the party.
content.summary: Orange orb that would light up then fade away traveling fairly fast

content.detailedDescription:
i was 20 y.O. at lackland afb, texas in october 1967. i was walking down the street at about 9pm. i was looking up at the stars, they are so bright there and at that time it was very dark on the street. i saw a round white light speed across the sky from the northwest. i grabbed someone on the street and got him to locate the object and say that he too saw it. as the object got overhead, it began to slow and as it slowed it went through a series of color changes, from white to blue to red-orange to yellow orange. it seemed to pulsate as it did this. then it stopped. it was almost directly overhead. a smaller round white light came out of the larger object. it seemed to drift away from the larger object. it was slow and a little zig zagging like a random drift away. then it suddenly shot away (east or southeast?)at an incredible speed. the larger object began to pulsate again and made a slow wide turn. it was white again and it also shot off at an amazing speed in the same direction it had come from. i cannot be sure but the whole thing probably only lasted a few minutes. 
     i did not have much of a reaction. i grabbed this guy because i wanted verification of what i was seeing. i guess right away i knew it was something strange. my main reaction was curiosity. the whole thing seemed strange to me and i could not think of anything to explain it. 
     later, i told people about it. most of them were interested. one a.F. guy tried to explain it away. he said it could have been a missile test and i was seeing a missile stage being jettisoned. then he said it could be a fighter plane shooting a missile. he said that the atmosphere can cause color changes. he said a lot of other possibilities but his point was that there must be a logical explanation and just because i didn't know what it was didn't mean i was seeing something strange or a ufo. 
     my reaction to this was that nothing he mentioned rang true in the least. he could be right about my not understanding something "normal" (for the air force), but it seemed pretty strange to me.    
     since then, i have seen satellites in the sky. they have a constant speed and a constant direction. unless there is cloud cover, they do not change any visible characteristics. i have seen the hale-bopp comet and i have also seen many "shooting stars" and most recently i saw part of the leonid meteor shower (an amazing experience). none of these things seem anything like what i saw in 1967.
content.summary: A round white light, changed speed and color, release a smaller object and went back the way it came.

content.detailedDescription: We were watching fireworks and noticed very bright object that looked almost fire like. object made no sound.  it seemed to pulsate some. we noticed it heading nw then head w. a plane was close by then object faded. this happened right about 9:50pm est. event lasted maybe 5 minutes from when we first noticed it.
content.summary: Object was very bright fire like came from nw then headed w. object made no noise. plane was in area then object faded.

content.detailedDescription: I saw orange light formations last night while watching the fireworks. they moved in a triangular pattern much much larger than an airplane. the lights would go out, then come in again. moving very slow but in a strict pattern and low like a thousand feet. i went on the internet and this is a common sighting that no one can explain. my friend said the news said it was helicopters, but even though she saw one she could not verify it was a helicopter. neither could anyone else i talked to who saw the same thing. i searched helicopters with orange lights and no matches. and no, they were not the candle lanterns. it was way to much larger than that. the stealth's here do not have orange lights. and they do make noise, these did not. very strange.
content.summary: I saw orange light formations last night while watching the fireworks. they moved in a triangular pattern much much larger than an airplane. the lights would go out, then come in again. moving very slow but in a strict pattern and low like a thousand feet

content.detailedDescription:
the ufo i saw was about 70 feet away and 20 feet above the ground.It was dark orange and the material the ufo was made out of emitted a bright orange light. the structure of the ufo was comparable to a upside down light-bulb. at the bottom of the ufo there was a single hole that i could see inside the craft through, the hole was also emitting red-orange light with a ball of red-orange light that was positioned at the center of the hole in the ufo without struts or bars attached to it.
 	 i heard the trees moving and i looked to my left near the top of the trees at my home and saw the ufo hovering behind the tree. the ufo then slowly moved at a speed around 10 mph to the end of my street. i yelled to my girlfriend who was beside me to look and i pointed at the ufo. the ufo immediately started hovering higher and moving away from my location at around 30 mph and gradually built up speed and rose higher until it was no longer visible.
 	after seeing the ufo, two of my friends and i were watching the skies for the ufo in case it returned. we watched for about an hour and noticed six other red orbs in different locations in the sky, three of the six orbs were flying individually. the other three orbs were in a triangular formation and flying in the same direction as if part of the same aircraft.
content.summary: Bright  lightbulb shaped glowing red-orange

content.detailedDescription: We were lighting fireworks when all the sudden i look to my south and notice red ball of light floating in the sky then vanished. i didn't think nothing of it. then 5 minutes later i zee 4-5 more red balls of light due nw rising up to the sky most of them disappeared and few of them took a flight path. then vanished.  after this i continue to see man more up to 12am coming from the west and more from the east. minimum of 20 total seen it was so amazing same time freaky!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Red orang glowing spheres.  random formation ascending and decending

content.detailedDescription: The object was first spotted through my windshield as i approached a fill in station, i watched the object cross the night sky and was amazed how its color and speed and lack of flashing lights drew my children and myself in. i was hoping that the object be just a helicopter or plane but the longer we examined what was in the sky the more clear it became that we could not explain what we were seeing. i filled my vehicle with fuel and headed to the hotel in which we were sleeping for the night which was about 5-8 miles from the gas station. as we approached the hotel we noticed the object again and this time we had time to stand outside the vehicle and try and get video footage with my iphone and ended up with a little over 3 minutes of footage of the object changing colors,elevation and direction within seconds. the object had strange patterns of flight path and colors and was extremly fast but could stop on a dime and remain stationary prior to redirecting and/or changing colors. amazing!!!
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path then hovering,Other
content.summary: The object flew across the sky changing flight paths abruptly and elevation and color also changed

content.detailedDescription:
New orleans,lake marina ave.Between 8:30 and 9:15. my girlfriend and i rust left a restaurant and were looking for a place to see fireworks, we walked toward the marinas looking for a pier. that was when i noticed lights in the sky that were not moving, they were flashing red then green,then bright white, but the white lights lasted longer then the rest, about seven seconds then back to the red and green lights.
 i noticed the lights because they where in a place were nothing should have been, they were over the lake, and very high.I pointed this out to my girlfriend,it just hovered there flashing.As we walked looking for a pier we were going in the direction of the lights, the sun had just started to set, it was not dark yet. we walked for about eight minutes,that's when i took out my iphone and started to take video of the object. 
 as we walked closer i could make out a shape, a dark solid something with flashing lights, in a place it should not have been hovering in the middle of the sky with no support. as we got closer i started to feel uncomfortable and told my girlfriend to turn around. as we left i still continued to video the object.
  we stopped at a walgreen drugstore to call a cab to back to our place,as i look back in the direction we just walked i could still see the object flashing, then nothing,it just wasn't there. 
  but i did get about five to seven minutes of the object.
content.summary: Near the pries on lake pontchartrain,looking north we noticed lights in the sky with no structures around it. they started

content.detailedDescription:
While working as a private security contractor at an apartment complex along burcale road, i was talking to a colleague from work when i observed 4 brilliantly lit objects moving from the south east to the north west. i asked my colleague if he was seeing the same objects and he stated yes he saw them also.

the objects appeared orb like and had a brilliant white light that appeared to turn amber along the very outer edge of the light then would go back to white light.

there was no sound associated with the objects and they moved much slower then an aircraft. their track took them through, what i know to be, the flight path for incoming aircraft into myrtle beach international airport.

my first thought was they were aircraft, flying dangerously close to each other, with very bright landing lights. but their path was towards conway, sc and away from the airport.

my colleague and i moved closer, from a parking lot to a lawn area between some buildings and burcale road. 

i went to get my phone to take a picture. my phone was in a pocket on my tactical vest. it took me no more than 30 seconds to get the phone, turn it on, and begin the camera function on the phone. when i presented the camera i could see that there were now only 3 objects. i snapped the picture.

when i asked my colleague what happened to the other object, he stated to me that it had fallen straight down and was trailing what he called "sparks" then disappeared.

my colleague and i are both veterans and both stated that the objects resembled a star cluster flare, used by u. s. military aircraft. but there had been no aircraft or even sounds of low flying aircraft, either just prior to, during, and after we observed the objects.

i also noted that there had been no report as there is with a military aircraft deploying star cluster flares.

the picture shows the objects just prior to us losing sight of them behind the tree line on the west side of burcale road.
content.summary: When first observed there were 4 objects travelling in a formation from south east to northwest.

content.detailedDescription: We had just returned from dinner on the 4th of july and i was letting the dog out in the driveway when i noticed a square object flying ne toward minneapolis. it was 100-200 feet up from me and traveling 20 mph or so. the underside appeared to be glowing as it moved above the very quiet neighborhood. i did not hear any noise at all as it moved. the sun had set, but it was still light out and you could see blue in the sky... the entire event lasted about 5 minutes. when our dog finished its business, i walked in and told my significant other about it. he ran, took the car and attempted to follow it but to no avail...
content.summary: Square shape with glowing underside traveling ne over savage about 20 mph. no noise at all and about 200 feet off ground

content.detailedDescription:
Walking outside to attempt to get fireworks photographs from a dark field near residence.  partner and i observed an object in the southwest that appeared to be a firework at first, but soon realized the object was hovering.  there were active fireworks to the south and some small fireworks in the community area adjacent to the park.  the object hung in the sky literally for a couple minutes, which ruled out the possibility that it was a rocket type firework.  the object then moved almost directly above as it traveled very slowly to the northeast from our location.  when the object came closer, it was apparent the object appeared to be on fire and had a cylinder type shape to it.  the object then continued slowly to the northeast and according to my partner it took an abrupt 90 degree turn in the sky (which i did not observe) and it was gone.  

the initial spotting of the object was about 21:25 and the even lasted to about 21:35.  

personal observations:
1. i initial thought the object was a rocket/firework.  
2. the object's bright red coloration was the first thing that we observed. 
3. the object appeared completely out of place in the area.  the height of the object appeared to be the same height as planes that are coming in from the west that travel east along the glide path for commercial aircraft that land in philadelphia international airport.  
4. lost sight of object as it traveled northeast.  in my opinion it was literally gone in a flash.  
5. gut reaction after realizing the object was not a firework was it's a ufo!  
6. i have seen a number of commercial and private aircraft fly above, and none had a solid red color on them that appeared like flames.  there were no navigational lights or landing lights.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Flaming red cigar shaped object

content.detailedDescription: At 9:13 i noticed a flashing white and blue orb for about 32 seconds then kept seeing 2 green orbs flying somewhat side by side for about 4 minutes. i was watching the orchestra perform and spotted them overhead. since i have had 2 other ufo sightings, i immediately knew there were ufos. the green orbs were moving very randomly everywhere until they disappeared. the blue and white flashing orb was flashing very rapidly and was not flashing in any sequence. since i have seen ufos before i was not frightened or disturbed in any way. i lost the green orbs as they departed west into the treetops. i lost the orb when it disappeared into the trees. ( not shown in film)
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Happened 2 hours before main firework display. these were not fireworks!

content.detailedDescription:
For the past couple of months on any clear evening star-like objects were observed in a general west to east orbit during which objects made erratic movements (up down side ways with no pattern to movements). sightings occurred after dark at approximately 9:30 pm to midnight. the number varies from 1 to 4. movements are sharp and erratic with multiple directional changes. initial thoughts were space stations or stars but with the movements observed these are definitely something else. noticed shape changes on several instances. in several instances airplanes were present noting objects were star-like and definitely far above the planes.

initial sighting was just looking up on a dark evening gazing at what i thought was a star when i noticed erratic movement of object. asked another person to verify. that person indicated not only was the object i observed moving erratically in an unnatural manner but there was another object acting in  a similar manner.

after a period of about 15 minutes went back inside. went back out about a half an hour later, objects had moved slightly east of initial position but were acting in the same manner. one would think these were stars but the movement patterns, change in brightness and occasional shape changes made me realize these are abnormal sightings!

it should be noted objects do not disappear but are there whenever we look on any clear evening!

sightings are occurring in my driveway. observations made with both the naked eye and with binoculars.
content.summary: Star-like objects erratically changing directions on a random basis

content.detailedDescription: I was walking my dogs along my street in mid-town north of the plaza a few minutes before midnight--probably during a 10 window between 11:45 and 11:55 pm (i was home by 11:57) on july 3, 2013 and noticed a fairly bright "star-like" object moving from sw to ne.  it was a pinpoint of light at this stage, looking a lot like mars on a clear viewing night in color in luminosity.  what attracted my attention was that it was a solid reddish-orange in color with no other apparent running lights or flashes.  it was moving fairly quickly, too fast to be an airliner at altitude, and completely silently.  having lived in the same neighborhood all my life i am familiar with the traffic patterns of most normal aircraft overhead in the area and the track of this object did not confirm to the usual norms.  i did not believe it to be a small fixed wing aircraft because of the lack of other running lights and no sound at all.  additionally, it traveled with a vague side-to-side motion, somewhat like a speedboat hitting waves on water.  it was clearly not a helicopter.  other possibilities i considered were a lighted balloon--which seemed unlikely due to brightness and speed--and some kind of fireworks or flare, which also seemed unlikely as the light was relatively bright, but star-like and constant rather than like that of flare and it showed no characteristics of "burning", smoke or other emission.  i observed the object for about 10 seconds before i passed under (and it passed over) the canopy of a couple small trees along the street.  at this point the object had attracted my attention but i still thought it was probably something typical and which had just looked "odd" for some reason.  i was fairly dismissive of it at this point.  odd lights in the night sky are not impressive to me.  when i passed out from under the canopy of trees, having lost sight of the object for about 10-20 seconds, i tried to get another look at it.  at first i didn't see it at all, which puzzled me because it was a fairly bright light and moved relatively fast compared to the background sky. i made a quick estimation of where it should have been, based on the line of direction and speed it was traveling when i went under the trees.  at that spot, i saw something that looked totally different than the reddish-orange pinpoint of light.  this object looked essentially like a "smoke-ring".  it was still slightly reddish-orange but could no longer be described as a "light".  it was circular in shape, approximately the size of a penny held at arm's length and had a darker center than the outer margin.  this object was difficult to see against the night sky.  it had a center "hole" or dark area which was darker than the outer ring but still not as dark as the night sky.  i could not tell if this object was still emitting a very weak light or if it was visible due to reflected light from ground sources.  it still maintained a slight reddish-orange color throughout though.  it continued in the same line of travel--sw to ne with a vague side-to-side fluttering motion--at the same apparent speed it had been traveling before i lost sight of it behind the canopy of the trees.  being close to the fourth of july holiday, i immediately considered whether this could be some kind of fireworks artifact or residue but concluded that, despite its "hazy" look and indistinct outer margin, this object was remaining coherent and unchanging in shape and density.  i was not hearing the sound of any fireworks around this time at all and had it been a vaporous object, smoke, haze, mist, etc, i have no doubt that whatever velocity wind it would have taken to move it that fast would have torn it apart.  this was one of the most compelling and striking aspects of the object; the fact that it looked indistinct but somehow remained consistent in appearance. it did look like it was possibly translucent but it never passed in front of any stars or other objects in order for me to really assess that possibility.   i believe this object to be the same star-like light that i had observed before passing under the trees based on its position, speed and direction of travel.  the only subsequent change in its appearance was it appearing to grow smaller, consistent with a solid object moving away into the distance. i watched this "smoke-ring" like object for probably 15-20 seconds before i lost it behind another row of trees to the north-east.  my reaction to the initial light was one of mild curiosity but mainly dismissal.  an unusual light in the sky might merit a second look but these are relatively common-place and meaningless.  it was when i saw the "smoke-ring" like object that i became very puzzled.  i have never seen anything like it.  i am familiar with the night sky; i know where the ecliptic can be found, can sight and name the major planets and basic constellations.  i've seen any number of "shooting stars" and have witnessed objects a few times burning up in the atmosphere that were later reported to have been "space junk".  i've seen fireworks, flares and even once launched a night-time hot air balloon made from a laundry bag.  this object looked like nothing i've ever seen before.  it was far too slow to be a meteor or space-junk and it moved too quickly to have been an airliner.  it was completely silent and did not resemble a private plane or helicopter and once it appeared in the "smoke-ring" form, actually had an unquantifiable aspect to it that made it seem almost "unreal" somehow.  i have no doubt i saw it though.  i even glanced away for a second and looked back at it and it was moving quickly enough that i had to look, not where i'd last seen it, but where it had moved to.  if i can offer a subjective impression, my feeling is that whatever this object was, when i first sighted it as a pin point light, it was much higher in the sky and coming toward me and descending at the same time. it seemed, when i first came out from under the trees, that the object, which now had a visible shape instead of being just a "light", had "powered down" and was maintaining a level flight.  again, at this point, the object was nearly as dark as the night sky, barely visible and i recall thinking at the time that if i hadn't known pretty much exactly where to look for it, i could have been almost staring at the sky and probably wouldn't have seen it.   my feelings afterward are of curiosity.  i don't claim this was a "space-craft" or "flying saucer".  i can't demonstrate anything of the sort.  it was, however, a most unusual object, the like of which i have never seen before and i've very interested in learning whether anyone else might have seen it.  i have no doubt though of what i saw and i'm not looking for external validation of the sighting so much as to whether anyone else might have additional details or, perhaps, an explanation for what this object might have been.
content.summary: Relatively bright star-like object which became hazy "smoke-ring" but maintained consistent shape

content.detailedDescription:
On july 4, 2013 at approximately 10:15pm we were looking west from silver lake in everett, wa, watching the fireworks displays and witnessed a roughly golf ball sized orb moving from north to south, high over the tree line, above the paine field area. it stood out because it was much larger and more stable than the fireworks and it didn't follow the usual pattern of fireworks exploding and fading in the sky surrounding it.

this is a heavily traveled small craft air corridor and we are confident it was not a small aircraft or helicopter as it's speed, shape or lighting was not comparable to either.  at first we thought it was the afterburner from a military jet leaving paine field, but then ruled that out as it made no associated noise and was moving far too low and far too slowly to be a military jet.  also, if it were a afterburner our perspective of it would have changed as the jet changed course.  this "orb" remained steady and true.

it maintained a steady speed, altitude and horizontal flight line for a couple of minutes then appeared to smoothly turn east, with no change in speed, somewhere over what may have been shoreline, wa. we continued tracking it east a bit further and observed it slow slightly over what might have been the seattle or bellevue area.  it is difficult to be sure of the distances involved.
  
it then very gradually came to a stop and hovered for a moment.  it appeared to "fizzle" or "fade" a bit and gradually disappeared.  we couldn't tell if it simply vanished or was moving south at a higher rate of speed and faded from view.

an acquaintance told us it is common for people to light chinese lanterns and float them on the 4th.  i can't say with any certainty what this was, but we are certain it was like nothing we witnessed before and it prompted me to make this report.
content.summary: Saw orange/red golf ball sized object moving south/east holding a vertical line

content.detailedDescription: On july 4th 930 pm i n festus mo watched 5the seperate bright orange glowing objectsthey hovered eent in different directions then took off into space at a high rate of speed
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Festus mo watched 5 orange fireballs hovet then shootin

content.detailedDescription:
My wife and i were sitting outdoors when i first spotted what i thought to be a roman candle firework (it was the 4th of july) but it kept going in a straight path for about a minute until it quickly faded out.  a few minutes later i saw more similar object heading in the same direction (wnw
). they too faded out one at a time as they went away leading me to believe the red lights were forward facing.  one more passed overhead followed by one more - only the last one just went dark instead of fading out.  we live on the flight path to our regional airport and are quuite use to planes as they come in to make thier final turn to the runway.  the planes are probably below 5,000 ft as the airport is only 20 minutes away so i think i can make a reasonable estimate of their altitue and speed.  the objects in question i would estimate to have been around 10,000 ft and travelling 200 - 300 mph.  but they made absolutely no noise and we can easily hear planes flying in to tulsa which is over an hour away.  since it was dark out, i have no idea of the physical size or shape, although i did try to observe if any backgroud sky-light or stars got blaked out after the objects went dark.  i saw no such effect.
content.summary: 1 object, then 3 in formations, two more singly.

content.detailedDescription: I did not have a sighting of a ufo.  i picked up a free real estate brochure over a year ago in the lynchburg, va area.  going through the brochure, i saw a picture of a home in a new subdivision that has an apparent ufo hovering above it.  this is not just a speck in the picture and is a fairly decent size.  it has the traditional saucer shape and appears to be a distance behind the home.  it is not a tower or structure of any kind behind the house.  i have subsequently gone to that subdivision and it is a wide open rural area.  at the time i decided not to do anything, since i was certain that many other people must have seen this photo and would report it.  i returned to the area this past october to search for properties again.  since the agent we were using is also the agent that had listed this property originally, i brought my copy of the brochure with me.  i showed her this picture and she was surprised by it.  she said that no one had ever brought this to her attention before.  she made copies of the page and asked other realtors there to get ahold of the original photo, which was taken by a photographer for the firm.  this agent is one of the co-owners of the real estate agency, so she did have the clout to pursue this.  she seemed to genuinely agree that this looked like an apparent ufo.  i have not been in touch with her following that time.  i told her that we would also be looking into properties in the pocono area in pa and would contact her if we decided on the lynchburg, va area.  i don't know what the outcome was but she seemed determined to pursue it.  i did mention mufon but i don't know if she knew about your organization.  i feel that you should see this photo and follow up on it.  for all i know, no one has bothered to do anything about this and i should at least notify you about it.  if you are interested, please contact me at the email address listed above.
content.summary: Photo of a new construction home in real estate brochure shows apparent ufo above the house.

content.detailedDescription: Noticed it outside my window.  ran out to observe.  it moved in a slow speed with change in color or height.  traveled from s to n in a straight line.  no sound no remnants in path.
content.summary: Red center orange large sphere moved s to n same speed

content.detailedDescription: Three orange globes appearing and disappearing on and off for about an hour.  we first spotted an orange orb floating directly over us and it caught our attentions.  it was completely silent, (not even a hum) and pulsating like an object on fire. it floated slowly directly over us and until it disappeared several miles away. we rode our bikes towards it when we looked in the sky and saw another triangle formation of 4 glowing orbs slowly disappearing one after another.  as we continued to ride, these objects kept appearing a disappearing about 7 times, anywhere from 2-4 orbs at a time.  sometimes they were close; other times further away. each time they looked like they were floating upward in the air until they were gone.  the lights were like nothing we have ever seen before. they were much brighter then planes or stars, and seemed to be pulsating. take a look at all of our videos from two perspectives; some are good and some are not as clear. don���t mind us freaking out a little in the videos���. it was very exciting and exhilarating.
content.summary: Orand glowing orbs floating in triangle formation repetedly
